data.title: Robert Ford (abt.1614-aft.1680)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Robert Ford born abt. 1614 England died 1680 St. Mary's County, Province of Maryland including research + descendants + 5 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Robert Ford

Born about 1614 in England

Son of [father unknown] and [mother unknown]

[sibling(s) unknown]

Husband of Lydia (Unknown) Ford — married [date unknown] [location unknown]

Descendants

Died after 1680 after about age 66 in St. Mary's County, Province of Maryland

Profile last modified 2 May 2022 | Created 16 Jun 2011

This page has been accessed 1,227 times.

Robert Ford migrated from England to Maryland.

Biography

Robert was born abt. 1612 in England.

Emigrated 22 SEP 1649 Made a deal in England to register for transport to America and be given land called 'Strand'. (Strand, Downham, Long in Dispence and Maypole) [1]

Ford, Robert, of St. Mary's Co., immigrated by 1667 with Lidia, his wife. Ford, Lidia was transported by 1667 by Robert of St. Mary's Co., her husband; service by 1663. [2]

Robert Ford passed away in 1668 in Maryland. Robert Ford was mentioned, as giving pt. of land "Strand" to grandsons John and Robert, in the Will of son Robert Ford written 27 Dec 1735, probate 15 Sept 1735 in St. Mary's Co., Maryland [3]

Marriage Lydia UNKNOWN

Children[4][2]

Honora FORD b: ABT. 1666

Margaret FORD b: BET. 1660 - 1671

Robert FORD b: 1664 in SMC, MD

Mary FORD

Suplementary Notes

John Sheircliffe 4.140. Mar 26 1677

Appraisers: Robert Ford, Thomas Salmon.

Anne Sheircliffe 4,14. 1 Mar 26 1677

Appraisers: Robert Ford, Thomas Salmon,

John Suttle 7A.185. Jul 26 1680

Appraisers: Thomas Carvile, Peeter Mills.

List of debts: Richard Gary, Robert Foord, William Sheirecliff, Vincent Mancell, Justinian Tennison, William Diggs, Esq., Thomas Ruies (?), John Right,

Bryan O'Bryan 10.140 1 SM £4.8.0

Appraisers: D. Brown, Robert Foord.

List of debts; William Harding, Robert Frazer

Sources

↑ 22 MAY 1667 The Strand survey, and patent issued to Robert Ford 6/1668

↑ 2.0 2.1 A Supplement to The Early Settlers of Maryland. Compiled and introduced by Dr. Carson Gibb, Ph.D., page 82

↑ Will of Robert Ford (abstract), Maryland Calendar of Wills, v8, pp100-01 [22.239]

↑ Title: Beverly Tyler from Elizabeth F Randolph's work. Dick Cooper

Early Colonial Settlers of Southern Maryland and Virginia's Northern Neck Counties database (Robert Ford Sr)

This week's featured connections are Acadians: Robert is 13 degrees from Joseph Broussard, 17 degrees from Louis Hebert, 19 degrees from Antonine Maillet, 18 degrees from Roméo LeBlanc, 18 degrees from Aubin-Edmond Arsenault, 18 degrees from Louis Robichaud, 17 degrees from Cleoma Falcon, 21 degrees from Rhéal Cormier, 18 degrees from Jack Kerouac, 20 degrees from Maurice Richard, 19 degrees from Ron Guidry and 19 degrees from Beyoncé Knowles-Carter on our single family tree.
